geninfo.para: Regardless of whether the cab is steel or aluminum, the following procedure should be followed when drilling a hole in a cab.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, shift transmission to neutral or park, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.

note.para: It is best to prime and paint the metal after drilling whenever possible and use a grommet to protect the paint repair from future abrasion. If it is not possible to repair the paint, please do the following:

step1.para: Remove drill shavings anywhere they come to rest within the cab, preferably with a vacuum cleaner.

Apply a rust inhibiting wax or moisture-cured sealant to the edge of the hole, seating rib of the grommet, or rivnut and attach to the cab. 3M MSP seam sealer, Tectyl 518, and Dow Corning 3145 RTV clear adhesive sealant are acceptable moisture-cured sealants.
